data.title: TV and film actor Eileen Ryan, Sean Penn’s mother, dies
data.meta_description: The matriarch of the steeped-in-the-arts Penn family was 94.
data.text:
MALIBU, Calif. — Eileen Ryan, who appeared on TV, in films, and on Broadway and who was the matriarch of the steeped-in-the-arts Penn family, has died. She was 94.

Ms. Ryan, the mother of actors Sean Penn and Christopher Penn and musician Michael Penn, died at her home in Malibu on Sunday, according to family spokesperson Mara Buxbaum. She would have turned 95 next Sunday.

“We lost mom yesterday,” Michael Penn tweeted with a broken heart emoji.

She had two roles on Broadway in the 1950s — both short-lived — in “Sing Till Tomorrow” in 1953 and “Comes a Day” in 1958.

In 1957, Ms. Ryan was at rehearsals for “Iceman Cometh” when she met Leo Penn, who had taken over for Jason Robards at the Circle in the Square production. They moved in together within a week of meeting and married a few months later. Leo Penn died in 1998.

Advertisement

Her TV credits include appearances on “Private Practice,” “The Twilight Zone,” “Bonanza,” “The Detectives,” “Marcus Welby, M.D.,” “Little House on the Prairie,” “Arli$$,” “Ally McBeal,” “NYPD Blue,” “ER,” “CSI,” “Men of a Certain Age,” and “Grey’s Anatomy.”

Her film roles included “Parenthood,” and “Benny & Joon.” She also acted in films with her sons, including “At Close Range,” “I Am Sam,” “The Indian Runner,” and “The Crossing Guard.”
